subject: Busy Week
event:
I've been juggling lots of balls this past week, but making good progress on a number of fronts.

All of the art is finally in for Subterranean Press's limited edition of FEVRE DREAM, and we've been going over the page proofs and placing the illustrations.   Justin Sweet has done some truly spectacular work for this one -- a great moody cover, three stunning full color plates, and a bunch of beautiful black and white interiors.  If you like illustrated books, this will be one you'll want to have, even if you've read FEVRE DREAM before.

Also been doing a lot of WILD CARDS work.  The first drafts of the stories for BUSTED FLUSH, the second of the new volumes, have been pouring in, and I've been reading them all and sending out notes to the writers for their rewrites.  With a project like WILD CARDS, the first draft is never the final one.  There's always a lot of revision required so the tales will fit together.  We're well on the way, however, and I think the book will be a strong one when it's done.  

And I've been working on A DANCE WITH DRAGONS too.  Just finished revising the prologue a few hours ago.  As I mentioned last post, after reading it at the Indianapolis convention, there were aspects of it that I was not happy with.  The new version is a page shorter and much stronger, I think, with a better flow and crisper transitions.  I also punched up one element that somehow had gotten lost before... but it was an important element, I believe, so I'm pleased that I was able to strengthen it.

Tomorrow is Parris's birthday, and we're off to the Bull Ring for some of Santa Fe's best steaks.  Phipps will find a lobster too, I'm sure.  She's going to be turning 29!

comments.article:
Just wanted to say that I'm a big fan. Thanks for making moral ambiguity a part of fantasy.


A 55-Word Story Every Day: http://55aday.blogspot.com
comments.subject: First post here, first post for me too!

comments.upictitle: OMG, it's a talking biscuit named Mara!: Nature-Redwood path
comments.article:
When I friended you, I had no idea you live in Santa Fe.

OK, so I'm a "pre-fan", I was doing some research for my son, who's in a place where he has no access to Internet but he's absolutely enthralled with your writing, and he asked me to find out when "A Dance With Dragons" would be out. Like many other fans, he's been a little...ermmmm...impatient :) I've todl him quality takes time, but, you know...

Anyway. My dad's lived in Santa Fe for 35 years, and I used to spend every summer there visiting him. I have some great memories from there, from going to places like the Bull Ring, Bishops' Lodge, the Palace, El Farol. Sadly the only place good New Mexican food can be had...is in New Mexico.

It's a lovely town. I'd move back except that the town isn't big enough for both me and my dad :)

Anyway...I hope you have a great night out!
comments.subject: Ohhhhhh...the Bull Ring....

comments.article:
Granted, I'm no expert on this subject, but in the Northern Virginia there is a chain of restaurants that was started by this woman named Anita whose husband was transferred from New Mexico to DC for work, and she couldn't find good Mexican food. She brought out all her recipes and started importing peppers, spices, and other ingredients from New Mexico. This was about30 years ago. Anita has since retired, but the business has grown in to 7 (soon to be 8) stores. The name is Anita's (terribly original name, I know).

To George: If you read this and ever want to put Anita's to the test, I'm buying.
comments.subject: Re: Ohhhhhh...the Bull Ring....

comments.article:
Congrats on the progress on all of your projects. And it must have felt good to get so much feedback on Dance at the con.
More importantly have fun on your night out!
Say Happy Birthday to Parris, from all of us!

I have an idea, a really good way to test the strength of the prologue would be to post it as a sample chapter on your website!

Well it was worth a try anyway

Happy Birthday to Parris!

It's always good to know that your heroes are persnickity, I'm sure Dance will be well worth the wait. As a bonus, all the folks from Indianapolis will get to pore over the revision muttering to themselves as they try to sort out what precisely was changed! Delicious muttering indianapolites.

Cheers.

comments.upictitle: [not pictured]: resilient reminiscent friendship hooray loved
comments.article:
Ah, why did I choose this year for picking up the rereleases of your older books? Especially Fevre Dream, which I ended having to buy twice already due to forgetfulness and dashing between planes.

And speaking of rereleases - or just taking advantage of the relatively few comments this post has received so far - are there any plans to reissue any of your short stories?
comments.subject: Although off-topic, none of this should be construed as not wishing Parris a happy birthday.

comments.article: Well, DREAMSONGS will be released in two hardcover volumes by Bantam this fall.  That has a wealth of my short fiction in it.

yay, happy bday Parris!
Tell her happy birthday and you crazy kids have fun! :)
I can't stop laughing at your icon! XD

And an advance Happy Birthday to you Lady, Parris. :D
I meant 'Your lady, Parris.' <font size="1">Eh. silly fingers.</font>

Everyone's heard this filk, but...

And best wishes to DWD, Wild Cards, etc.

comments.article:
It's a Subterranean Press release, which means you'll have to order it directly from them. They do ship to the U.K. for not very much.

Their website is at www.subterraneanpress.com/

comments.article:
Happy birthday Parris:)

Looking forward to Fevre Dream, it sounds great.

Gosh, that Fevre Dream limited edition sure is tempting...

Komarck's art for the cover of Inside Straight is amazing. And Lohengrin (if I'm guessing right) is suddenly very nearly (just needs lighter hair) our mental image of Arthur Dayne, which is a bonus.

Happy Birthday to Parris :)

Glad to hear you're so much happier with the Prologue now. It's fanscinating to me to hear about the sorts of things that go in to this kind of revision of the work as it's being created.
Good Luck, George! :)
